item.title: A large pile of trash partially blocking alley next to my block of flats, 16th January
item.description:
Various disposed items, many large like sofas, chairs, mattresses, pieces of wood, pallets, etc left in access alley to bins and back yard - maybe mixture of block residents and outside opportunists dumping it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadoak Avenue, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Botched Repair (Again), 16th January
item.description:
Thames Water workmen have been to repair the collapsed drain on the pavement outside my house and once again have botched the job. The Thames Water employee was hosing the area to clean up and the water was pooling just as badly as before. There is clearly something worse going on under the surface but nobody seems to be bothered to fix it properly. I refuse to wait for another heavy rain storm to take photos...it is botched and proper investigation needs to be done on what is causing the problem under the surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped sofa cushions, 16th January
item.description:
More fly tipping on Whiteley Road. This is becoming more and more of a problem. As it’s not dealt with, more and more people are doing it assuming they can get away with it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Whiteley Road, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Bed frames left on pavement 16Jan26, 16th January
item.description:
Someone has left these bed frames on the pavement on the corner of The Oaks / Burrage Road junction. Photo taken 16th January, they’ve been there all week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burrage Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: School restriction markings not visible, 16th January
item.description:
The yellow zig zag lines outside the pedestrian entrance to Crofton Junior School on Shepperton Road are worn away and not clearly visible. The markings are not enough of a deterrent and people continue to stop, wait and park in this location making it dangerous for children and parents walking to school and crossing in this location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shepperton Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
